meanings.definition: The act of applying mercury to something.
meanings.sent1: The mercurations on the old thermometer were carefully done.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the mercurations on the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent3: The artist's mercurations on the canvas created a unique effect.
meanings.sent4: The mercurations on the mirror reflected a distorted image.
meanings.sent5: The mercurations on the statue made it gleam in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The process of treating or preserving something with mercury.
meanings.sent1: The mercurations of the antique clock helped maintain its shine.
meanings.sent2: The mercurations of the old documents were necessary for preservation.
meanings.sent3: The chef's mercurations of the food gave it a metallic taste.
meanings.sent4: The mercurations of the wood made it resistant to decay.
meanings.sent5: The mercurations of the jewelry kept it looking new.
